<text id="0">
	Dawn: Hi, \v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000!\nAre you catching Pokémon?\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Wow! You’ve already got \v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000 Pokémon\nwith you!\rAt that pace, your Pokédex should\nbe full in no time at all!\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	...Um...\rI think you’d feel a lot safer if you\nwere to catch some more.\rYou know, like when you need to travel\nto faraway places.\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Oh, I know! Don’t you think it’s\nbetter to know more about Pokémon?\rSure it is!\nI know just the place.\rCome on!\nDon’t be shy. Follow me!\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Lucas: Hey, \v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000!\nHow many Pokémon have you caught?\r
</text>
<text id="5">
	Whoa! You already have \v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000 Pokémon\nwith you!\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	Huh?\nI think you should catch some more.\rIt might be more of a challenge\nraising a lot of Pokémon...\rBut it’s worth it. The more Pokémon\nyou have, the happier you’ll be.\r
</text>
<text id="7">
	Hey, that’s right! Don’t you think it’s\nbetter to know more about Pokémon?\rSure it is!\nThere’s this great place for that.\rCome on! It’s all right.\nFollow me.\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	Dawn: That man...\nWhat is he doing?\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	Dawn: Um...
</text>
<text id="10">
	Lucas: That guy...\nWhat’s he doing?\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	Lucas: Uh, excuse...
</text>
<text id="12">
	WHAAAT?!\r
</text>
<text id="13">
	Mysterious man: ...How did you know?\rHow did you unmask me as a member of\nthe International Police?!\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	Dawn: Huh? What? I beg your pardon?\nI was just making conversation...\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	Lucas: Huh? What? Are you kidding?\nI was just making small talk...\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	Shady man: ...Heh. You claim you were\nonly making conversation, do you?\rBut, I know better not to believe that.\nNo, no, no.\rYou recognized right away that I was\nsomeone extraordinary.\rThat is why you spoke to me, is it not?\nYour power of observation is fearsome!\rQuite admirable, you are!\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	Now that my cover has been blown, let\nme introduce myself.\rI am a globe-trotting elite of the\nInternational Police.\rMy name... Ah, no, I shall inform you\nonly of my code name.\rMy code name, it is Looker.\nIt is what they all call me.\rIncidentally, is the saying, “Don’t be\na thief!” familiar to you?
</text>
<text id="18">
	Looker: Yes, that is correct.\nTaking what belongs to others is wrong.\r
</text>
<text id="19">
	Looker: No? You claim to not know it?\nHow could that be?\rPerhaps your mama has said it, but you\nhave forgotten it, like usual?\rNow listen, my friends. It is wrong to\ntake what belongs to others.\r
</text>
<text id="20">
	Unfortunately, there are apparently\nthose who do not heed those words.\rIn Sinnoh, in fact, there are criminals\nstealing the Pokémon of others.\rI have, therefore, been on the lookout\nfor characters arousing my suspicion.\rIncidentally, you are Trainers, yes?\nPerhaps you can make use of this?\r
</text>
<text id="21">
	That Vs. Recorder, it is a nifty device\nfor recording a match.\rI obtained it because it is quite popular\nthese days.\rBut myself, I do not do Pokémon\nbattling very often.\rIt will be in better hands with you.\r
</text>
<text id="22">
	Looker: Also, I have a request.\rIf you were to see me again, I ask that\nyou not talk to me, for I am on duty.\r...Actually, yes, yes, you may speak to\nme. You must.\rNot because I am lonely, no, no!\nYou must inform me of bad guys!\lYou must inform me of any happenings!\r
</text>
<text id="23">
	Dawn: ...Working for the International\nPolice must be hard.\r
</text>
<text id="24">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, here it is.\nIt’s the Trainers’ School.\lThe name says it all!\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	I saw your friend \v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000 go in\nearlier.\rHe could still be in there studying.\nOK, bye now!\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	Lucas: ...Working for the International\nPolice sounds hard.\r
</text>
<text id="27">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, here we are.\nThis is the Trainers’ School.\lThe name says it all!\r
</text>
<text id="28">
	Your pal \v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000 went in earlier.\nHe might still be studying in there.\rOK, see you around!\r
</text>
<text id="29">
	Jubilife City’s built on land they\ncarved out of a mountain.\rThe people and Pokémon of Oreburgh\nCity helped out with that undertaking.
</text>
<text id="30">
	Hello! Let me ask you, have you paid\na visit to the TV station?\rIf you’ve never been, you owe it to\nyourself to make the trip.\rAnd, if you’ve been there before,\nit never hurts to visit again.\rAfter all, you can be a star!\nOr at least dream of being one!
</text>
<text id="31">
	Ah, it is you! Have no fear.\nThere are no shady characters about.\rIncidentally, have you visited the\nTrainers’ School?\rDid your friend not guide you there\nearlier?
</text>
<text id="32">
	Looker: Hello, my friend.\nHave you visited the Trainers’ School?\rDid your friend not guide you there\nearlier?\r
</text>
<text id="33">
	Ah, it is you! Have no fear.\nThere are no shady characters about.\rIncidentally, have you not obtained\na Pokétch?\rI believe a Pokétch is now free in\nexchange for some Coupons?
</text>
<text id="34">
	Looker: Tell me, have you not obtained\na Pokétch?\rI believe a Pokétch is now free in\nexchange for some Coupons?\r
</text>
<text id="35">
	Ah, it is you! Have no fear.\nThere are no shady characters about.\rIncidentally, have you not obtained\na Gym Badge?\rI believe you receive one for defeating\nthe Gym Leader at a Pokémon Gym?
</text>
<text id="36">
	Looker: Tell me, have you not obtained\na Pal Pad?\rIs not a Pal Pad free to anyone visiting\nthe Pokémon Center’s basement?\r
</text>
<text id="37">
	Ah, yes. I see that you have obtained\nit, a Pal Pad for yourself.\rI myself, a member of the International\nPolice, the fighters of crime around the\lworld, have one also.\rFor it is what one must have to trade\nPokémon with Trainers around the world.\rTake that Pal Pad to the Global Terminal\nfor trading on an international level!\r
</text>
<text id="38">
	Anyway, there appears to be no one\nshady in this Jubilife City.\rI shall therefore take my investigation\nelsewhere.\rBut, my friend, I suggest you remain\nvigilant for shady grown-ups!\r
</text>
<text id="39">
	Oh, oh, oh?\rYou call yourself a Pokémon Trainer?\nAnd yet you have no Pokétch?\rThat is, Pokémon Watch, or Pokétch\nfor short!\rOh my, you are a rare case\nindeed!\r
</text>
<text id="40">
	You see, I invented, and now\nmanufacture, Pokétches.\rNot only that, I’m now conducting\nthe Pokétch promotional campaign!\rAll you have to do is find three\nclowns in Jubilife City.\rIf you can find them...\nI will gift you with a Pokétch!
</text>
<text id="41">
	The three clowns will each ask you\na skill-testing question.\rThe questions will all have to do\nwith Pokémon.\rAfter all, a Pokétch is a tool for\nPokémon Trainers.\rCollect a Coupon from each clown,\nthen come see me, OK?
</text>
<text id="42">
	OK, let me count your Coupons!\nI’ll use the Pokétch here...\rOne, two, three!\nBravo! I say, bravo!\rIn return for these Coupons,\nI present you this Pokémon Watch,\lor Pokétch for short!\r
</text>
<text id="43">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000 received a \vFF00\x0001\x0001Pokétch\vFF00\x0001\x0000!\v0200\x0001\x0001
</text>
<text id="44">
	You can add apps to your Pokétch\nto make it even more versatile!\rTouch the Pokétch screen and find the\napps that are right for you!\r
</text>
<text id="45">
	Hi! I’m a Pokétch campaign clown!\nLet’s roll out my question!\rDoes a Pokémon grow by defeating\nothers and gaining Exp. Points?
</text>
<text id="46">
	Ding-ding!\nYou’re absolutely correct!\r
</text>
<text id="47">
	Bzzzzt!\nThat’s the wrong answer...
</text>
<text id="48">
	Pokémon grow stronger by defeating\nother Pokémon in battle.\rSome Pokémon even grow into an\nentirely different form in a process\lknown as evolution.\r
</text>
<text id="49">
	Here you go!\nYour Pokétch Coupon!\r
</text>
<text id="50">
	Pokémon grow stronger through\nbattling.\rSome Pokémon even grow into an\nentirely different form in a process\lknown as evolution.
</text>
<text id="51">
	Hi! I’m a Pokétch campaign clown!\nLet’s roll out my question!\rJust like Pokémon types, the moves\nof Pokémon also have types?
</text>
<text id="52">
	Ding-ding!\nYou’re absolutely correct!\r
</text>
<text id="53">
	Bzzzzt!\nThat’s the wrong answer...
</text>
<text id="54">
	If the Pokémon’s type matches its\nmove’s type, that move is made much\lmore powerful!\r
</text>
<text id="55">
	Here you go!\nYour Pokétch Coupon!\r
</text>
<text id="56">
	If the Pokémon’s type matches its\nmove’s type, that move is made much\lmore powerful!
</text>
<text id="57">
	Hi! I’m a Pokétch campaign clown!\nLet’s roll out my question!\rCan a Pokémon hold an item?
</text>
<text id="58">
	Ding-ding!\nYou’re absolutely correct!\r
</text>
<text id="59">
	Bzzzzt!\nThat’s the wrong answer...
</text>
<text id="60">
	A Pokémon may hold a single item.\rSome items become effective as soon\nas they are held by a Pokémon.\rBerries are eaten by Pokémon as\nnecessary during battle.\r
</text>
<text id="61">
	Here you go!\nYour Pokétch Coupon!\r
</text>
<text id="62">
	Hi, there. You should stick around.\nWe’re doing a Pokétch campaign soon.\rBefore it starts, I think you should\nbrush up at the Trainers’ School.

<text id="63">

<text id="34">
	There is a mysterious notebook here.\nIts age is impossible to tell.\r“It was by pure chance that I obtained\ninformation about the Pokémon ROTOM.\r“Remarkably, ROTOM has the ability to\nenter and merge with special motors.\r“It’s now known that ROTOM can stay\ninside a motor almost indefinitely.\r“However, it will emerge if it enters a\nUnion Room or a Wi-Fi Club.\r“ROTOM will also emerge from the motor\nif it is left at the Day Care.\r“ROTOM may also forget certain moves\nwhen it leaves a motor.\r“This Pokémon requires exhaustive\nobservation and analysis.\r“To ensure I get all the credit, my\nROTOM research must be kept secret.\r“They will come to recognize me as the\nscientific genius Char...”\rThe rest of the notebook is blank.
</text>
<text id="35">
	Rowan: Ah, imagine finding you here!\rYou must be eager to fill your Pokédex\nto be searching even here.\rWhat am I doing?\rI visit a professor I know in Eterna\nevery so often.\rHe tells me intriguing rumors of rare\nPokémon sightings and such.\r
</text>
<text id="36">
	A Pokémon that slips into electric\nappliances, you say...\rHmm...\rThat is somewhat off from what I’ve\nheard about it.\rHmm...\nThis is what I’ve heard.\rLong ago, there was a Pokémon that\nmerged with a toy robot.\rShould that Pokémon be recognized as a\nnew species or not...\rDebates over the issue were about to\nstart when they were rendered moot.\rThe very topic of discussion--the\nPokémon-infused robot--disappeared...\r
</text>
<text id="37">
	Anyway, this ROTOM...\nWhat an interesting Pokémon.\rSo, you say it enters an appliance and\nessentially merges with the device.\rIn the process, it may also learn new\nmoves.\rIn a way, I suppose it could be thought\nof as a mechanical Pokémon.\rHmm...!\rThough it is utterly unique, it is\nundeniably a form of Pokémon.\rFine, fine, so be it!\rNo matter how old one gets, there will\nalways be new Pokémon discoveries!\rTake care, \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000!\r
</text>
<text id="38">
	It’s an old notebook.\nThere’s no telling how old it is.\rWould you like to read it?
</text>
<text id="39">
	“Our encounter was a sudden one.\r“It was when I found my toy robot,\none that I had earlier misplaced.\r“At that instant, a Pokémon startlingly\nemerged from the lawn mower’s motor!\r“Clutching my robot, I stared,\ntransfixed by the peculiar Pokémon.”\r...Would you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="40">
	“The Pokémon hovered in the air, held\naloft by a power unseen.\r“As if curious and unafraid of my\npresence, it floated toward me.\r“Crackling sounds accompanied it, as \nif from static electricity in the air.\r“Remarkably, it seemed the Pokémon\nwas the source of this power!\r“In alarm, I flinched, certain that my\nface would be subjected to a shock.\r“Much to my surprise, the Pokémon\nseemed to favor me with a smile.”\r...Would you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="41">
	“Finally, I came to realize that the\nPokémon only wished to be friends.\r“I have decided to name this most\nwondrous Pokémon ’ROTOM.’\r“Simple though it may be, ROTOM emerged\nto me from the motor of a lawn mower.\r“Motor and ROTOM...\nSurely the link is obvious?”\r...Would you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="42">
	“ROTOM is a Pokémon that is simply\nsensational.\r“The fact that it can turn invisible is\nsimply the beginning.\r“What makes ROTOM unique is its ability\nto enter and operate machinery!”\r...This is about halfway through.\nWould you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="43">
	“ROTOM and I became fast friends.\nWe were perpetual companions.\r“The electricity from its body forbade\ncontact, however.\r“We could not touch, let alone hug or\nhold hands, but we cared not.\r“For we were bonded on a much deeper,\nincorporeal level.”\r...Would you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="44">
	“A feeling of mischief got the better\nof me one day.\r“Seeing ROTOM hovering, I decided to\nstartle it--normally I would not.\r“Perhaps frightened, ROTOM discharged\npower beyond its usual range.\r“I fell, stunned, into the arms of\nunconsciousness...”\r...Would you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="45">
	“When I came to, to my horror I\nrealized that ROTOM had disappeared.\r“I searched high and low for my friend\nin dismay and desperation.\r“’Don’t chastise yourself.’\r“’The fault is mine. No harm done.’\r“’Let us play as we always have.’\r“Though my words poured out, my friend\ncould not be found to hear them...”\r...Would you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="46">
	“My search for ROTOM carried me far\nfrom home.\r“It was in the town’s rubbish heap that\nI again found my old toy robot.\r“Curiously, our eyes met, then the\nrobot waved a hand as if in greeting.\r“I knew then that I had found my lost\nfriend.\r“I ran to it and hugged ROTOM tight,\ntalking on and on.”\r...Would you like to keep reading?
</text>
<text id="47">
	“The robot’s eyes lit up happily as\nI held it.\r“I’m certain that, within it, ROTOM was \nemitting lots of electricity.\r“Somehow, I felt I could understand\nROTOM’s thoughts better than before.\r“Also, I realized that we would remain\nfriends throughout our lives...”\r...The notebook ends with this page...

<text id="6">

</text>
<text id="7">

</text>
<text id="8">
	Expert Belt!\rThis hold item boosts the power of a\nsuper-effective move to 120%.\rIt’d be useful for a Pokémon that knows\ndifferent types of moves.\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	Life Orb!\rThis hold item boosts the power of\nall the Pokémon’s moves to 130%!\rHowever! It also takes 10% of the\nholder’s HP every time a move is used.\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	Choice Scarf!\rThis hold item boosts the Speed of the\nPokémon to 150%!\rHowever, and beware of this, it will\nonly allow one move to be used.\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	Choice Band!\rThis hold item boosts the Attack stat\nof the Pokémon to 150%.\rBeware, it has no effect on the Special\nAttack stat. Make no mistake of it.\r
</text>
<text id="12">
	Choice Specs!\rThis hold item boosts the Special Attack\nstat of the Pokémon to 150%.\rBeware, it has no effect on the Attack\nstat. Make no mistake of it.\r
</text>
<text id="13">
	Leftovers!\rAt the end of a turn, after both sides\nhave made their moves, this hold item\lrestores HP by about 6%.\rThe recovered HP could well be the\ndifference in a tight battle.\r

	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000 chose to retire.

<text id="55">

</text>
<text id="57">

<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Contest Hall.\rI can help you with registering\nfor a Super Contest.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to enter a Pokémon\nin a Contest?
</text>
<text id="5">
	What would you like to know about?
</text>
<text id="6">
	    
</text>
<text id="7">
	Welcome to the Contest Hall!\rThis is the reception counter for\nlinked Super Contests.\rYou may join a group of friends to\nenter your Pokémon in the same\lSuper Contest over a link.\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	ENTER
</text>
<text id="9">
	INFO
</text>
<text id="10">
	EXIT
</text>
<text id="11">
	We look forward to your participation\nanother time!
</text>
<text id="12">
	Would you like to\nenter a link Contest?
</text>
<text id="13">
	Two to four players may compete\nusing wireless communications.\rFirst, choose the Contest you wish\nto enter.\rNext, make sure the other people in\nyour group choose the same Contest.\rThen, the players each choose a\nPokémon to enter the Contest, and\lthat’s it for registration!\rAfter that, the Contest starts in\nthe usual way.\rWe hope you’ll try it out.\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	A Pokémon Super Contest involves\nfour Trainers.\rEach one enters a Pokémon to\ncompete against the others.\rJudging is conducted in three\ncategories: Visual, Dance, and\lActing.\rThe Pokémon scoring the highest in\nthe three categories is the winner.\rIf this is your first time, it is\nrecommended you try some practice\lsessions before entering a Contest.\rThe registration counter for practice\nsessions is at the far right.\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	In the Visual Competition, Pokémon\nare rated on their appearance.\rScoring is based on votes cast by\nthe audience.\rFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	In the Dance Competition, the Pokémon\nwill get to show off their footwork.\rTry to put on coordinated dance\nperformances with everyone!\rFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	In the Acting Competition, the\nPokémon will perform their moves in\lfront of Judges.\rTry to get your Pokémon to put on\nperformances that stand out from the\lrest of the pack!\rFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	There are five Contests in all:\nCool, Beauty, Cute, Smart, and Tough.\rBe sure to choose the Contest that\nbest suits the Pokémon you want to\lenter with.\r
</text>
<text id="19">
	There are four different ranks to\nthe Pokémon Super Contests.\rThe four ranks are Normal, Great,\nUltra, and Master.\rThe Normal Rank is open for entry\nby any Pokémon.\rA Pokémon winning a Normal Rank\nContest may move up to the Great\lRank in the same category.\rLikewise, win a Great Contest and\nbecome eligible for the Ultra Rank.\rAn Ultra Rank winner may move up to\nthe Master Rank in the same way.\rA Master Rank winner may enter\nMaster Rank Contests as often as\lthe Trainer wishes.\r
</text>

	Which Pokémon would you like to\nenter?\r

<text id="112">

</text>

</text>

</text>
<text id="120">
	ACTING
</text>
<text id="121">
	PRACTICE
</text>
<text id="122">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="123">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="124">
	A Contest involves judging in three\ncategories: Visual, Dance, and Acting.\rHere you may practice each of these\ncategories before you actually enter\la real Contest.\rThere’s just one thing. Your Pokémon\nmust know at least two moves.\rOtherwise, it will not qualify for our\nSuper Contests.\r
</text>
<text id="125">
	OVERALL FLOW
</text>
<text id="126">
	CONDITION POINTS
</text>
<text id="127">
	DRESS-UP POINTS
</text>
<text id="128">
	    
</text>
<text id="129">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="130">
	Judging here is based on the visual\nappeal of Pokémon.\rScoring is based on voting by the\naudience.\rThe more popular the Pokémon, the\nhigher its score!\rThe Pokémon are scored in two\ncategories: Condition Points and\lDress-Up Points.\r
</text>
<text id="131">
	Condition Points are scored on\nthe Pokémon’s condition in one of\lfive categories.\rThe five conditions are: Cool, Beauty,\nCute, Smart, and Tough.\rThese conditions can be enhanced by\nfeeding Poffins to your Pokémon.\rIf the audience likes what they see,\n\vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks will appear.\rObviously, the more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks there\nare, the more popular the Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="132">
	Dress-Up Points are awarded for\nfashionably dressing up your Pokémon\lwith Accessories.\rBefore you begin, you will be given\na fashion theme.\rYour dressed-up Pokémon will be\nscored on how well it matches the\lassigned theme.\rThe audience’s approval will appear\nas pink \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks.\rBe sure to position the Accessories\nproperly and attach them firmly.\lThey won’t stay on otherwise.\rThere is a time limit of 60 seconds.\rGet your Pokémon dressed up within\nthat time.\r
</text>
<text id="133">
	    
</text>
<text id="134">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="135">
	OVERALL FLOW
</text>
<text id="136">
	BACKUP DANCER
</text>
<text id="137">
	MAIN DANCER
</text>
<text id="138">
	PANEL
</text>
<text id="139">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="140">
	In a Dance Competition, the four\ncontestants take on different parts.\rOne becomes the main dancer, and the\nremaining three are backup dancers.\rThe main dancer scores points by\nperforming inspired dance steps\lthat the others can’t copy.\rThe backup dancers earn high scores\nby duplicating the dance steps\llaid down by the main dancer.\r
</text>
<text id="141">
	Your Pokémon will first appear as\na backup dancer.\rMake it dance using the same timing\nas the main dancer.\rUse the castanets to show your\nPokémon which direction the main\ldancer turned.\r
</text>
<text id="142">
	The main dancer rotates with a\nbackup dancer so everyone gets\la turn.\rWhen your Pokémon is the main dancer,\nshow it how to dance!\r
</text>
<text id="143">
	The melody will be shown playing on\nthe red and blue panels.\rThe panel colors show who should be\ndancing.\rThe main dancer can dance while the\nmelody is in the blue panels.\rBackup dancers must dance only\nduring the red panels.\rThe dancers must perform the\nrequired number of dance steps\lduring their time slots.\r
</text>
<text id="144">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="145">
	OVERALL FLOW
</text>
<text id="146">
	CONTEST MOVES
</text>
<text id="147">
	JUDGES
</text>
<text id="148">
	VOLTAGE
</text>
<text id="149">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="150">
	In the Acting Competition, four\nPokémon will perform their moves for\lour panel of Judges.\rThe more a Pokémon stands out, the\nhigher it scores.\rEach Pokémon will get the chance to\nperform four times.\r
</text>
<text id="151">
	Every move has one or more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks\nthat indicate the acting score.\rThe more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks obtained, the\nhigher the Pokémon scores.\rHowever, Pokémon are not permitted\nto perform the same move two turns\lin a row.\r
</text>
<text id="152">
	There are three Judges in all.\rYou get to choose which one you want\nto judge your Pokémon.\rTry not to have your Pokémon scored\nby the same Judge as other Pokémon\lso it can stand out more.\rIf your Pokémon leaves a strong\nimpression, it will be rated highly,\learning it more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks.\r
</text>
<text id="153">
	Voltage shows the excitement level\nof the Judges.\rIn a Cool Contest, if a Pokémon uses\na Cool move, Voltage goes up.\rHowever, if a Cute or Smart move is\nperformed, the Voltage goes down.\rIf the Voltage reaches 5 points, the\nPokémon earns bonus points.\rIf the Special Judge in the center\nwas chosen, 8 bonus points are\lawarded when the Voltage peaks.\rFor the other Judges, 5 bonus points\nare awarded.\r
</text>
<text id="154">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="155">
	VISUAL PRACTICE
</text>
<text id="156">
	DANCE PRACTICE
</text>

<text id="0">
	Dexter: That’s it, folks!\nAll judging has been completed!\rWhich Pokémon will be crowned the\nwinner?\rLet’s announce the results!\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	First, the results of the Visual\nCompetition!\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	Next, let’s have the results of the\nDance Competition!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	And finally, here are the results of\nthe Acting Competition!\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Dexter: The winner is...\nEntry number \v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000!\r\v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000 and \v0100ぁぁ\x0000!\nCongratulations!\r
</text>
<text id="5">
	And now, it’s time to announce the\nresults of the individual categories!\r
</text>

<file id="219" change="false">
<text id="0">
	sleep
</text>
<text id="1">
	poison
</text>
<text id="2">
	burn
</text>
<text id="3">
	paralysis
</text>

<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Pokémon Communication\nClub Colosseum.\rYou may battle with your friends\nhere.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which Battle Mode would you like\nto play?
</text>
<text id="2">
	There are four Battle Modes.\rSingle Battle is for two Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\rDouble Battle is for two Trainers\nwith two or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer will send out two\nPokémon to battle at a time.\rMix Battle is for two Trainers\nwith three Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer chooses one of the\nopponent’s Pokémon, mixes them\rwith their own party, and then\nbattles the other Trainer.\rMulti Battle is for four Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\r
</text>

<file id="309" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rThis is your first visit?\nRight this way, please!\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Oh! You have a Vs. Recorder!\nHow nice!\rWe upgrade Vs. Recorders for first-time\nvisitors for Battle Frontier use.\rI’ll borrow yours for a moment.\rLet’s see... Slide open this part here,\nand ticka-tacka-kachunk there!\rAll done!\nHere you go.\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s Vs. Recorder was\nupgraded.
</text>
<text id="3">
	Our other staff will be pleased to\nexplain how the individual facilities\lof the Battle Frontier operate.\rI can go over general topics.\nDo you have any questions?
</text>
<text id="4">
	Which topic should I explain?
</text>
<text id="5">
	The Battle Frontier has five facilities\ndedicated to battling.\rAt the Battle Tower, the objective is\nto beat seven Trainers in a row.\rAt the Battle Hall, you may keep battle\nrecords of individual Pokémon.\rAt the Battle Factory, you must win\nconsecutive battles with rentals.\rThe Battle Castle forces Trainers to\nmanage Castle Points to advance.\rAnd finally, the Battle Arcade is where\nrandom luck triggers events.\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	The battles at the five Battle Frontier\nfacilities are held under special rules.\rFirst and foremost, no Exp. Points\ncan be earned.\rConsequently, the Pokémon battling\nhere will not level up.\rIf the Level 50 rule is chosen,\nPokémon of higher levels will be\ltemporarily reduced to Lv. 50.\rPokémon under Lv. 50 will be entered\nwithout an upward level adjustment.\r
</text>
<text id="7">
	Battle Points are usually referred to\nas BP.\rBP are points that are used only in\nthe Battle Frontier.\rBP are awarded for meeting certain\nperformance goals at the various\lBattle Frontier facilities.\rBP can be exchanged for prizes at\nthe Exchange Service Corner.\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	The Exchange Service Corner is the\ntent straight ahead past here.\rThere, you may exchange your BP for\na wide variety of prizes.\rPlease do visit it!\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	The Performance Monitor shows Trainer\ndata, such as the previous record and\lthe best record to date.\rYou will find one near the reception\ncounter in each facility.\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="11">
	BATTLE FRONTIER
</text>
<text id="12">
	BATTLE POINTS
</text>
<text id="13">
	EXCHANGE SERVICE CORNER

<text id="17">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the Battle Tower\nworks?
</text>
<text id="18">
	The Battle Tower is the building at the\nback of the Battle Frontier.\rThe object is to enter a team of\ndifferent Pokémon and battle on until\lyou lose.\r
</text>
<text id="19">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="20">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the Battle Factory\nworks?
</text>
<text id="21">
	The Battle Factory is at the upper-\nright corner of the Battle Frontier.\rThere, you engage in a knockout\ntournament with rented Pokémon.\rThe goal is to keep winning for\nas long as possible.\rEvery time you win a match, you may\ntrade one of your Pokémon for one of\lthe opponent’s Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="22">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="23">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the Battle Hall\nworks?
</text>
<text id="24">
	The Battle Hall is at the upper-left\ncorner of the Battle Frontier.\rHere, you enter one Pokémon of your\nchoosing for one-on-one battles.\rThe objective is to keep your winning\nstreak going as long as possible.\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="26">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the Battle Castle\nworks?
</text>
<text id="27">
	The Battle Castle is at the lower-left\ncorner of the Battle Frontier.\rHere, you are provided with Castle\nPoints, CP, that you must manage.\rThe CP are used for healing Pokémon,\nrenting items or Berries, and so on.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive while managing your CP.\r
</text>
<text id="28">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="29">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the Battle Arcade\nworks?
</text>
<text id="30">
	The Battle Arcade is at the lower-right\ncorner of the Battle Frontier.\rHere, a game board is activated\nbefore every match.\rDepending on what comes up on the\ngame board, an event takes place.\rSome events will be good to the\nchallenger, while others won’t be.\rThe challenger may even avoid having\nto battle at all.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive as long as possible.\r
</text>
<text id="31">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="32">
	The Battle Frontier is up ahead!\rWhat kinds of Trainers will I see?\nWhat battles will I experience?\rIt’s a whole new adventure for me!
</text>
<text id="33">
	The five facilities of the Battle\nFrontier are...\rTower.\rHall.\rCastle.\rFactory.\rAnd Arcade.\rHow do you make an acronym out of\nthat? THCFA?\rRearrange those letters, maybe?\nFATCH! CHAFT!\r...Nope! Nothing works!\nDidn’t anyone think of this?!
</text>
<text id="34">
	The Vs. Recorder is sure nifty!\rTouching the screen shows you how\nmuch BP you have.
</text>
<text id="35">
	My dream is to battle Palmer of the\nBattle Tower.\rI want to record it for posterity on\nmy Vs. Recorder.\rBut I’m not good enough to battle my\nway to see Palmer... I’m heartbroken!
</text>
</file>
<file id="310" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Factory!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would you like to take?
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Factory, you may take\nSingle or Double Battle challenges\lusing rental Pokémon.\rOnce entered, your challenge lasts\nuntil you lose.\rAfter each win, you may trade a rented\nPokémon for one of the opponent’s.\rThe Level 50 option starts you off with\nPokémon that only know weak moves.\rThe Open Level option gives you access\nto Lv. 100 Pokémon with powerful moves\lfrom the start.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Factory!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle\nFactory Multi Battle challenge?
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge using rental\lPokémon.\rBoth partners will be provided with two\nrental Pokémon each.\rOnce entered, you and your partner\nconduct Multi Battles until you lose.\rAfter each win, you or your partner\nmay trade a single rented Pokémon.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rThe Level 50 option starts with rental\nPokémon that only know weak moves.\rThe Open Level option lets you rent\nLv. 100 Pokémon with powerful moves\lfrom the start.\rPlease note: a Battle Factory Multi\nBattle challenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	We hope to see you again!
</text>
<text id="7">
	Which challenge level would you like to\nplay? Level 50 or Open Level?
</text>

<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Hall!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would you like to take?
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Hall, you may take Single\nor Double Battle challenges alone.\rFor the Single Battle challenge, you\nenter one Pokémon of at least Lv. 30.\rThe Double Battle Challenge requires\nyou to enter two of the same kind of\lPokémon that are at least Lv. 30 each.\rWinning-streak records are kept for\nindividual kinds of Pokémon.\rThat makes it possible for any kind of\nPokémon to aim for no. 1.\rWhen you enter the Hall, you will be\nasked to choose the type and rank of\lthe Pokémon you want to battle.\rIf you manage to win ten matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Hall!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle Hall\nMulti Battle challenge?
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge using the\rsame kind of Pokémon that are at\nleast Lv. 30 each.\rWhen you enter the Hall, you will be\nasked to choose the type and rank of\lthe Pokémon you want to battle.\rIf you manage to win ten matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rPlease note: a Battle Hall Multi Battle\nchallenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>

<text id="63">

<text id="64">

</text>
<text id="65">

<file id="312" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Castle!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would you like to take?
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Castle, you may take a\nSingle or Double Battle challenge.\rHere, you are provided with Castle\nPoints (CP) that you must manage.\rThe CP are used for healing Pokémon,\nrenting items or Berries, and so on.\rCP are earned by winning matches.\nThe amount varies by how you win.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive while managing your CP.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Castle!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle Castle\nMulti Battle challenge?
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge.\rBoth Trainers are provided with Castle\nPoints (CP) that must be managed.\rThe CP is used for healing Pokémon,\nrenting items or Berries, and so on.\rTrainers can use their CP on not only\ntheir own Pokémon, but also their\lpartner’s.\rBoth Trainers earn CP by winning\nmatches.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive while managing your CP.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rPlease note: a Battle Castle Multi\nBattle challenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	We hope to see you again!
</text>

<file id="313" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Arcade!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would you like to take?
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Arcade, you may take a\nSingle or Double Battle challenge.\rHere, a game board is activated\nbefore every match.\rDepending on what comes up on the\ngame board, an event takes place.\rSome events will be good for the\nchallenger, while others won’t be.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive as long as possible.\rDuring your challenge, any items held by\nyour Pokémon will be kept in storage.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Arcade!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle\nArcade Multi Battle challenge?
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge.\rHere, a game board is activated\nbefore every match.\rDepending on what comes up on the\ngame board, an event takes place.\rThe events may have great impact on\nthe match’s outcome, good or bad.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive as long as possible.\rDuring your challenge, any items held by\nyour Pokémon will be kept in storage.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rPlease note: a Battle Arcade Multi\nBattle challenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>

</text>
<text id="2">
	...No, of course, you wouldn’t.\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Genes can be considered the blueprints\nof all life-forms.\rThat includes humans and Pokémon alike.\rGenes are contained in a DNA strand.\rA DNA strand consists of two chains\nof opposing characteristics in a spiral.\rIf one of the chains were to be broken,\nthe other could replicate it.\rOne or the other cannot exist without\nits opposite.\rDo you understand where I am going\nwith this?\rThis is a bizarre world.\nTime doesn’t flow.\lSpace isn’t stable.\rOnly that shadowy Pokémon lives\nhere.\rThis world is the opposite of our \nworld--our world I wish to change.\rIt is like the two chains composing a\nstrand of DNA.\rThe two worlds must be balancing each\nother to remain in existence.\rWithout the one, the other cannot\nexist.\rThe shadowy Pokémon must play a role in\nkeeping the worlds in balance.\rThat is why it must have interfered\nand brought me here.\r
</text>
<text id="4">

</text>
<text id="7">
	Your pace is picking up.\nThings can only get better!
</text>
<text id="8">
	Be persistent when you’re searching\nfor Pokémon that appear only in\lcertain places.
</text>
<text id="9">
	Are you using fishing rods?\rPokémon that live underwater need to\nbe caught by fishing.
</text>
<text id="10">
	Remember, it’s important to make the\nPokémon you’ve caught evolve.
</text>
<text id="11">
	Pokémon don’t just hide in tall grass.\rYou can find many others in caves and\nseas.
</text>
<text id="12">
	The Trainers that challenge you to\nbattle have Pokémon, obviously.\rThey may have rare ones with them,\nand that can add to your Pokédex.
</text>
<text id="13">
	Some Pokémon appear only in the\nmorning and some only at night.\rI know it’s a challenge, but I urge you\nto keep searching.
</text>
<text id="14">
	Fantastic! Your effort is helping us\nunderstand what evolving involves.\rYour Pokédex doesn’t have long to go\nnow.
</text>
<text id="15">
	I’m simply astounded by the huge\nvariety of Pokémon in Sinnoh.\rThis will help my studies immensely!\nSincerely, thank you!
</text>
<text id="16">
	Your Pokédex is well on the way to\nbeing filled up.\rThis Pokédex can be considered a\njournal of your adventure.
</text>
<text id="17">
	You’re not far from seeing every\nPokémon there is to see in Sinnoh!
</text>

</text>
<text id="24">

</text>
<text id="25">

<text id="26">
	Have you visited the Great Marsh?\rSome Pokémon only appear in places\nsuch as that.

<text id="28">

</text>
<text id="29">

</text>
<text id="30">

</text>
<text id="31">

<file id="389" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Hello there!\nIt’s so very nice to meet you!\rWelcome to the world of Pokémon!\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	My name is Rowan.\rHowever, everyone just calls me\nthe Pokémon Professor.\rBefore I go any further, is this\nyour first adventure?\rIf you need advice, I’m certainly\ncapable of giving it.\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	Moves the main character.\nAlso used to choose various\nheadings and selections.\n\nUsed to confirm a choice, check\nthings, chat, and scroll text.\n\nUsed to exit, cancel a choice,\nand cancel a mode.
</text>
<text id="3">
	Press to open the menu.\n\nPress to use an item, such\nas a Bicycle, that has been\nregistered in advance.
</text>
<text id="4">
	The lower screen is called\nthe Touch Screen.\n\nThe Touch Screen will display\na variety of touch buttons\ndepending on the situation.
</text>
<text id="5">
	If this mark is shown in the\nmessage window, there are active\nbuttons you can touch on the\nTouch Screen below.
</text>
<text id="6">
	\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="7">
	Do you understand everything\nso far?\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="8">
	Please touch a button on the\nTouch Screen below.\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="9">
	Would you like to know more about\nanything else?\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	You are about to enter a world\nwhere you will embark on a grand\nadventure of your very own.
</text>
<text id="11">
	Speak to people and check things\nwherever you go, be it in towns,\nroads, or caves.\nGather information and hints from\nevery possible source.
</text>
<text id="12">
	New paths will open to you when\nyou help people in need, overcome\nchallenges, and solve mysteries.
</text>
<text id="13">
	At times, you will be challenged\nby others to a battle.\nAt other times, wild creatures\nmay stand in your way.\n\nBy overcoming such hurdles,\nyou will gain great power.
</text>
<text id="14">
	However, your adventure is not\nsolely about becoming powerful.
</text>
<text id="15">
	On your travels, we hope that\nyou will meet countless people\nand, through them, achieve\npersonal growth.\n\nThis is the most important\nobjective of this adventure.
</text>
<text id="16">
	This world is widely inhabited by\ncreatures known as Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	Here, I have a Poké Ball.\rTouch the button on the middle of\nthe Poké Ball, if you’d please.\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="18">
	No, no! Not that button!\nThe button on the Poké Ball.\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="19">
	We humans live alongside Pokémon\nas friends.\rAt times we play together,\nand at other times we\lwork together.\rSome people use their Pokémon\nto battle and develop\lcloser bonds with them.\rWhat do I do?\rI conduct research so that we may\nlearn more about Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="20">
	Now, why don’t you tell me\na little bit about yourself?\r
</text>
<text id="21">
	Are you a boy?\nOr are you a girl?\r
</text>
<text id="22">
	All right, so you’re a boy?\r
</text>
<text id="23">
	All right, so you’re a girl?\r
</text>
<text id="24">
	Tell me, what is your name?\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	Your name is \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000?\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	Your name is \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000?\r
</text>
<text id="27">
	OK...\nSo, you’re \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000?\rA fine name that is!\rNow, this boy here...\nI believe he’s your friend.\r
</text>
<text id="28">
	What might his name be?\r
</text>
<text id="29">
	\v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000, is it?\nThat’s your friend’s name?\r
</text>
<text id="30">
	All right, \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, the time\nhas come.\rYour very own tale of grand\nadventure is about to unfold.\rOn your journey, you will meet\ncountless Pokémon and people.\rI’m sure that along the way you will\ndiscover many things, perhaps even\lsomething about yourself.\rNow, go on, leap into the world of\nPokémon!\r
</text>

<text id="0">
	
</text>
<text id="1">
	a \vFF00\x0001◎BULBASAUR\vFF00\x0001\x0000
</text>

	an \vFF00\x0001◎IVYSAUR\vFF00\x0001\x0000

	a \vFF00\x0001◎VENUSAUR\vFF00\x0001\x0000
</text>

</text>
<text id="5">
	a \vFF00\x0001◎CHARMELEON\vFF00\x0001\x0000

	a \vFF00\x0001◎CHARIZARD\vFF00\x0001\x0000

<text id="21">
	After some fits and starts, a childhood\nfriend gave me my first Pokémon!\r...But it was a KRICKETOT.\nWhen I don’t like the legs of bugs...\rI bet he gave me this because I picked\non him when he was little...\rBut though the road has been long and\nhard, I’m finally at the starting line!\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” episode 2!\r“The Maiden in Love and the KRICKETOT.\nThe Magic of Romance Never Ends!”\rOh, this KRICKETOT is a female.\nMaybe we can be friends.
</text>
<text id="22">
	I checked out my KRICKETOT and learned\nabout its moves.\r...It only knows Growl and Bide.\nThat’s worse than just challenging!\rI was about to say that, when my\nchildhood friend stopped me.\r“Let it hold an Oran Berry so that\nit can survive while using Bide.”\rHey, that’s smart!\nThat’s from a former Bug Catcher!\rWhile we’re at it, can I have an Oran\nBerry, too?\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” episode 3!\r“Love Conquers All. Covering Weakness\nwith Ideas!”\rWe’re a Trainer and Pokémon now!\nWe’ll get stronger together!
</text>
<text id="23">
	I had my first ever Pokémon battle,\nand it ended badly...\rMy childhood friend, a former\nBug Catcher, had this to say.\r“Pokémon get tougher by battling.\nThe key to victory is type matchups.”\rType matchups?\nTypes affect battles?\rThe only type matchup I care about is\nwith that Gym Leader!\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” episode 4!\r“Type Matchups Settle Battles!\nMoves That Exploit Weak Points!”\rFire, Flying, and Rock...\nKRICKETOT has some disadvantages!
</text>
<text id="24">
	We’d win a battle, and lose one.\nLose one, then win one.\rThough it was discouraging, I had to\nkeep battling to toughen us up.\rWith me and KRICKETOT, it was always\nthree steps forward, two steps back.\rBut we were getting stronger. Then one\nday, KRICKETOT started to shine!\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” episode 5!\r“KRICKETOT Becomes KRICKETUNE! Watch\nMe! I’ll Change, Too!”\rAnd, to cancel evolution, press the\nB Button... Tell me that first!
</text>
<text id="25">
	After KRICKETOT evolved, she became\nstronger as KRICKETUNE.\rWe also got other Pokémon, so we could\ngo farther and farther from home.\rBut where is my beloved Gym Leader?\nWhere is that city he said he’s from?\rI do have the Town Map, but maps baffle\nme.\rIt doesn’t matter, though.\nIf we keep moving, we’ll get somewhere.\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” episode 6!\r“How Is This Possible? Pokémon Gyms\nCan’t Be Found Everywhere!”\rThe more lost you are, the less useful\na map becomes! You know it’s true!
</text>
<text id="26">
	Our journey was long, and it was hard.\nBut no one wants to hear that!\rSo, I finally found my Gym Leader.\nBut, he has an incurable disease!\rHe begged me, out of the blue, with his\nlast wish.\rHe asked for my Pokémon!\nBut my KRICKETUNE’s my partner!\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” episode 7!\r“My Trail of Footprints Shortened\nthe Distance Between Us!”\rEvery time I see KRICKETUNE’s face, I\nget reminded of our time together...
</text>
<text id="27">
	My beloved Gym Leader, whom I\nfought so hard to meet, was a fraud!\rHow dare he con this pure maiden!\nHow dare he toy with my emotions!\rBut whose fault was it?\nWas it mine to be taken in?\rAll I know is that my tears overflow,\nand despair is my world...\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” episode 8!\r“KRICKETUNE and I! Our Bond Is True!”\rThat Gym Leader’s eating a Giga Impact\nfor playing me for a fool!
</text>
<text id="28">
	Having defeated the fake Gym Leader,\nKRICKETUNE and I stood in a daze.\rWe were spent. Drained by a romance\nthat ended as a nightmare.\rIt was then my childhood friend, the\nformer Bug Catcher, arrived.\rHe did more than that.\nHe confessed his love to me!\r“I wanted to become an Elite Four\nmember so I quit as a Gym Leader.\r“But, then, that faker appeared.\nYou took care of him, though!”\rWait, ex-Bug Catcher! What?\nWhat are you saying?!\rNext week: “The Diary of a Poké\nRomantic,” final episode!\r“Do it, KRICKETUNE! Silver Wind over\nSinnoh Skies!”\rYou were laughing at me for falling for\nthat fraud, weren’t you?
</text>
</file>

<text id="0">

<text id="1">

</text>

	Because of its hollow inside pocket,\nthere isn’t a lot to eat. What can be\neaten is very sweet and delicious.

</text>

</text>
<text id="8">

</text>
<text id="9">
	Sitrus came from the same family as\nOran. It is larger and smoother tasting\nthan Oran.
</text>
<text id="10">

</text>
<text id="11">

</text>
<text id="12">
	This Berry progressively curves as\nit grows. The curvier the Berry, the\nsweeter and tastier.
</text>
<text id="13">

</text>
<text id="14">

</text>
<text id="15">

</text>

	The potent mix of bitter and sour in\nthis Berry seems to promote digestion.\nThe flower is white and beautiful.
</text>

</text>

<text id="24">

</text>

</text>

</text>
<text id="30">

</text>

	This Berry drifted from a faraway sea.\nIt is now cultivated in the Sinnoh\nregion.

<file id="547" change="false">
<text id="0">
	I’m the Day-Care Man.\rWe look after the precious Pokémon\nof other Trainers.\rIf you’d like us to raise your\nPokémon, have a word with my wife.
</text>
<text id="1">
	Ah, it’s you!\rWe were raising your Pokémon,\nand my goodness, were we surprised!\rYour Pokémon was holding an Egg!\rWe don’t know how it got there,\nbut your Pokémon had it.\rYou do want it, don’t you?
</text>
<text id="2">
	Ah, it’s you! Good to see you.\nYour \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000’s doing just fine.
</text>
<text id="3">
	Well then, I’ll hang on to it.\nThanks!
</text>
<text id="4">
	You have no room for it right now...\nCome back when you’ve made room.
</text>
<text id="5">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000 received the Egg from\nthe Day-Care Man.
</text>
<text id="6">
	You take good care of it.
</text>
<text id="7">
	By the way, I saw your \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000\ncavorting with \v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000’s\l\v0100ぁぁ\x0000.\rI may even have seen it receiving\na piece of Mail.
</text>
<text id="8">
	If you want to pick up your Pokémon,\nhave a word with my wife.
</text>
<text id="9">
	Ah, it’s you!\nGood to see you!\rYour \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000 and \v0100ぁ\x0001\x0000\nare doing just fine.\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	I really will keep it.\nYou do want this, yes?
</text>
<text id="11">
	The two seem to get along very well.
</text>
<text id="12">
	The two seem to get along.
</text>
<text id="13">
	The two don’t seem to like each\nother much.
</text>
<text id="14">
	The two prefer to play with other\nPokémon more than with each other.
</text>
<text id="15">
	I’m the Day-Care Lady.\nWe can raise Pokémon for you.\rWould you like us to raise your\nPokémon?
</text>
<text id="16">
	Which Pokémon should we raise for\nyou?\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	Fine, we’ll raise your \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000\nfor a while.\rCome back for it later.\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	We can raise two of your Pokémon.\nWould you like us to raise another?
</text>
<text id="19">
	Ah, there you are!\nMy husband was looking for you.
</text>
<text id="20">
	Oh, fine, then.\nCome again.
</text>
<text id="21">
	You don’t have enough money...
</text>
<text id="22">
	Do you want to take back the other\none, too?
</text>
<text id="23">
	Very good.\nCome again.
</text>
<text id="24">
	Ah, it’s you! Good to see you.\nNow, about your Pokémon...\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	By level, your \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000 has\ngrown by about \v0133ぁ\x0001\x0000.\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	Your Pokémon team is full.\nMake room, then come see me.
</text>
<text id="27">
	Which Pokémon will you take back?
</text>
<text id="28">
	If you want your \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000 back,\nit will cost ¥\v0135ぁ\x0001\x0000.
</text>
<text id="29">
	Excellent!\nHere’s your Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="30">
	\v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000 took \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000 back\nfrom the Day-Care Lady.\r
</text>
<text id="31">
	Oh? But you only have one\nPokémon with you.\rYou can’t go off without a Pokémon.\nCome back another time.
</text>
<text id="32">
	Do you want your Pokémon back?
</text>
<text id="33">
	If you leave me that Pokémon,\nwhat are you gonna battle with?\rCome back another time.
</text>
<text id="34">
	Huh? Now, now.\rIf you leave that Pokémon with\nme, you’ll be left with just one.\rYou will be better off if you catch\nsome more, if I do say so myself.
</text>
<text id="35">
	Now, now.\nThat is merely an Egg!
</text>
<text id="36">
	Fine, we’ll raise your \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000\nfor a while.\rCome back for it later.
</text>
<text id="37">
	Huh?
</text>
<text id="38">
	Lv. \v0134ぁ\x0001\x0000

<file id="612" change="false">
<text id="0">
	 -
</text>
<text id="1">
	The stench helps keep\nwild Pokémon away.
</text>
<text id="2">
	The Pokémon makes it rain\nif it appears in battle.
</text>
<text id="3">
	The Pokémon’s Speed stat\nis gradually boosted.
</text>
<text id="4">
	The Pokémon is protected\nagainst critical hits.
</text>
<text id="5">
	The Pokémon is protected\nagainst 1-hit KO attacks.
</text>
<text id="6">
	Prevents combatants from\nself destructing.
</text>
<text id="7">
	The Pokémon is protected\nfrom paralysis.
</text>
<text id="8">
	Boosts the Pokémon’s\nevasion in a sandstorm.
</text>
<text id="9">
	Contact with the Pokémon\nmay cause paralysis.
</text>
<text id="10">
	Restores HP if hit by an\nElectric-type move.
</text>
<text id="11">
	Restores HP if hit by a\nWater-type move.
</text>
<text id="12">
	Prevents the Pokémon\nfrom becoming infatuated.
</text>
<text id="13">
	Eliminates the effects of\nweather.
</text>
<text id="14">
	The Pokémon’s accuracy is\nboosted.
</text>
<text id="15">
	Prevents the Pokémon\nfrom falling asleep.
</text>
<text id="16">
	Changes the Pokémon’s\ntype to the foe’s move.
</text>
<text id="17">
	Prevents the Pokémon\nfrom getting poisoned.
</text>
<text id="18">
	Powers up Fire-type moves\nif hit by a fire move.
</text>
<text id="19">
	Blocks the added effects\nof attacks taken.
</text>
<text id="20">
	Prevents the Pokémon\nfrom becoming confused.
</text>
<text id="21">
	Negates moves that\nforce switching out.
</text>
<text id="22">
	Lowers the foe’s Attack\nstat.
</text>
<text id="23">
	Prevents the foe from\nescaping.
</text>
<text id="24">
	Inflicts damage to the\nfoe on contact.
</text>
<text id="25">
	Only supereffective\nmoves will hit.
</text>
<text id="26">
	Gives full immunity to all\nGround-type moves.
</text>
<text id="27">
	Contact may paralyze,\npoison, or cause sleep.
</text>
<text id="28">
	Passes on a burn, poison,\nor paralysis to the foe.
</text>
<text id="29">
	Prevents the Pokémon’s\nstats from being lowered.
</text>
<text id="30">
	All status problems are\nhealed upon switching out.
</text>
<text id="31">
	The Pokémon draws in all\nElectric-type moves.
</text>
<text id="32">
	Boosts the likelihood of\nadded effects appearing.
</text>
<text id="33">
	Boosts the Pokémon’s\nSpeed in rain.
</text>
<text id="34">
	Boosts the Pokémon’s\nSpeed in sunshine.
</text>
<text id="35">
	Raises the likelihood of\nmeeting wild Pokémon.
</text>
<text id="36">
	The Pokémon copies the\nfoe’s ability.
</text>
<text id="37">
	Raises the Pokémon’s\nAttack stat.
</text>
<text id="38">
	Contact with the Pokémon\nmay poison the foe.
</text>
<text id="39">
	The Pokémon is protected\nfrom flinching.
</text>
<text id="40">
	Prevents the Pokémon\nfrom becoming frozen.
</text>
<text id="41">
	Prevents the Pokémon\nfrom getting a burn.
</text>
<text id="42">
	Prevents Steel-type\nPokémon from escaping.
</text>
<text id="43">
	Gives full immunity to all\nsound-based moves.
</text>
<text id="44">
	The Pokémon gradually\nrecovers HP in rain.
</text>
<text id="45">
	The Pokémon summons a\nsandstorm in battle.
</text>
<text id="46">
	The Pokémon raises the\nfoe’s PP usage.
</text>
<text id="47">
	Raises resistance to Fire-\nand Ice-type moves.
</text>
<text id="48">
	The Pokémon awakens\nquickly from sleep.
</text>
<text id="49">
	Contact with the Pokémon\nmay burn the foe.
</text>
<text id="50">
	Enables sure getaway from\nwild Pokémon.
</text>
<text id="51">
	Prevents the Pokémon\nfrom losing accuracy.
</text>
<text id="52">
	Prevents the Attack stat\nfrom being lowered.
</text>
<text id="53">
	The Pokémon may pick up\nitems.
</text>
<text id="54">
	The Pokémon can’t attack\non consecutive turns.
</text>
<text id="55">
	Boosts the Attack stat,\nbut lowers accuracy.
</text>
<text id="56">
	Contact with the Pokémon\nmay cause infatuation.
</text>
<text id="57">
	Boosts Sp. Atk if another\nPokémon has Minus.
</text>
<text id="58">
	Boosts Sp. Atk if another\nPokémon has Plus.
</text>
<text id="59">
	CASTFORM transforms with\nthe weather.
</text>
<text id="60">
	Protects the Pokémon\nfrom item theft.
</text>
<text id="61">
	The Pokémon may heal its\nown status problems.

	The loser has to pretend to be a\nSTUNKY, OK?
</text>
<text id="871">
	Giggle, you lose.\nI want to see your STUNKY impression!\r
</text>
<text id="872">
	OK, here’s my STUNKY impression!\nThree, two, one...\r
</text>
<text id="873">
	A good breeze has sprung up...\nThis is good! I can win this!
</text>
<text id="874">
	The tailwind put us over the top!\n...As they say!\r
</text>
<text id="875">
	The headwind worked against us!\n...As they say!\r
</text>
<text id="876">
	Even though I always have my parasol\nup, I actually like sunny days.
</text>
<text id="877">
	I hope it will be sunny tomorrow...\r
</text>
<text id="878">
	The heavy downpour in my heart...\nWhen will it ever stop...?\r
</text>
<text id="879">
	My, you’re very eager to go. I’d better\ntake the tension up a notch, too!
</text>
<text id="880">
	I had a lot of fun with that match!\nWouldn’t it be nice to see you again!\r
</text>
<text id="881">
	You’re so full of energy!\nWhy, I feel energized, too!\r
</text>
<text id="882">
	How much longer do I have to wait for a\nTrainer that’s any good?
</text>
<text id="883">
	I’m so bored by the weak competition.\nMaybe I’ll just retire.\r
</text>
<text id="884">
	Oh, hello, there.\nNow, you’re a little special.\r
</text>
<text id="885">
	My ladylike charms don’t mean a thing\nto a little kid...
</text>
<text id="886">
	That was too close for comfort!\nIt doesn’t pay to underestimate foes.\r
</text>
<text id="887">
	Battling fair and square doesn’t appeal\nto me. I’d rather win.\r
</text>
<text id="888">
	Like everything else, people have likes\nand dislikes when it comes to scents.
</text>
<text id="889">
	I love how Pokémon smell after a battle.\r
</text>
<text id="890">
	I feel a little thrill if I catch a whiff\nof intense effort postbattle.\r
</text>
<text id="891">
	Sniff, sniff... Yes! Here it comes!\nAroma power!
</text>
<text id="892">
	With aroma power, I’m invincible!\r
</text>
<text id="893">
	Fizzle...\nI’m out of aroma power...\r
</text>
<text id="894">
	Turn, step, turn, turn... I’ll practice\nmy dance steps while battling!
</text>
<text id="895">
	I dance with passion and precision.\nHow can there be a weakness?\r
</text>
<text id="896">
	You’re throwing off my rhythm!\nMy dance routine is ruined!\r
</text>
<text id="897">
	I’m always ready for the public eye.\nYou can come at me at your own pace.
</text>
<text id="898">
	That’s why people consider me the\nperfect Idol.\r
</text>
<text id="899">
	I didn’t know how bad it feels to lose.\nThis is a first for me.\r

<text id="0">
	Fly to where?

<text id="1">
	GUIDE MAP
</text>
<text id="2">
	A small path through a lush, green,\nwooded area. The densely grown trees\ngive off a thick aroma.
</text>
<text id="3">
	A winding path that twists through\ngrassy fields. Young Trainers like to\ntest their battle skills here.
</text>
<text id="4">
	Despite being so close to a big town,\nthis path retains its relaxed, natural\natmosphere.
</text>
<text id="5">
	Once one gets through the tunnel,\nthe city of Oreburgh is just a stone’s\nthrow away.
</text>
<text id="6">
	A charmingly natural path that wanders\npast many ponds and groves of trees.
</text>
<text id="7">
	The Ravaged Path was hewn through\na rocky outcropping. It is a shortcut\nthat leads straight to Floaroma Town.
</text>
<text id="8">
	A wide, wooden walkway spans a large\npond. Fishermen idle their time away\ndangling lines from the walkway.
</text>
<text id="9">
	A quietly flowing stream and hilly\nterrain with one-way ledges make this\na fun area for adventure.
</text>
<text id="10">
	Near the entrance of Eterna Forest\nis a cabin whose keepers offer rest\nto weary travelers that stop by.
</text>
<text id="11">
	Smoothly paved in asphalt, the Cycling\nRoad is heavenly for bicycle lovers.
</text>
<text id="12">
	Below the Cycling Road, one can see\nthe entrance to Wayward Cave.
</text>
<text id="13">
	Located at the foot of Mt. Coronet,\nthis road is carved into the rugged,\nrocky terrain.
</text>
<text id="14">
	A lush field of grass spreads from\nMt. Coronet’s sheer rock face,\ncreating a vista of contrasts.
</text>
<text id="15">
	The Berry Master, an old man who loves\nnature, Pokémon, and Berries, makes\nhis home here.
</text>
<text id="16">
	The streams forded by this path wind\npast copses and grassy patches in\na serene and soothing manner.
</text>
<text id="17">
	The Lost Tower is where Pokémon are\nlaid to rest when their lives come\nto an end.
</text>
<text id="18">
	A canyon covered in untamed nature.\nIt is always shrouded by a dense fog.
</text>
<text id="19">
	Grandma Wilma’s house stands alone in an\nisolated spot deep among mountains.
</text>
<text id="20">
	This narrow route is lined with deep,\ntall grass that tickles the noses of\npeople straying off the path.
</text>
<text id="21">
	The Café Cabin stands in a wood.\nThe house special is freshly milked\nMoomoo Milk.
</text>
<text id="22">
	A mountain path that tunnels through\nMt. Coronet, one of the tallest\nmountains in Sinnoh.
</text>
<text id="23">
	A tall, sturdy wall surrounds an\nexpansive estate that takes up nearly\nhalf of the road space.
</text>
<text id="24">
	Beyond the wall, one can see the\nstately Pokémon Mansion and the\nowner’s prized garden behind it.\n
</text>
<text id="25">
	This path weaves among deep puddles\nmade by the unending rainfall. It is\nwet and miserable for Trainers.
</text>
<text id="26">
	There is a house here whose residents\noffer to trade TMs for Red, Blue,\nYellow, or Green Shards.
</text>
<text id="27">
	Offshore boulders form a jetty that\nbecalms waves reaching the beach.\nA resort hotel overlooks the water.
</text>
<text id="28">
	In a small house on the beach lives\na single man who refers to himself as\nDr. Footstep.
</text>
<text id="29">
	The road joining Veilstone City and a\nlake is described as either “wildly\nnatural” or simply “a mess.”
</text>
<text id="30">
	There is a cave hewn into the sheer\nrock wall at the roadside. The hole\nwas made by a Ruin Maniac.
</text>
<text id="31">
	This area is always inundated by heavy\nrainfall. Only hardy Trainers that can\ntake the rain gather here.
</text>
<text id="32">
	This mountainous road leads from Mt.\nCoronet. Its constant snowfall and\ndeep snowdrifts impede travelers.
</text>
<text id="33">
	Snow blows down from Mt. Coronet and\ngrows into a harsh, ceaseless blizzard.\nBe prepared for the worst.
</text>
<text id="34">
	Despite its shortness, this road is\nrevered by fishing enthusiasts as a\ngreat, yet little known, fishing spot.
</text>
<text id="35">
	A beautiful white-sand beach only five\nseconds on foot from Sandgem Town.\nA pleasant breeze blows from the sea.
</text>
<text id="36">
	The sea here is perfect for swimming,\nwith gentle winds and tides. There are\nsandbars for resting, too.
</text>
<text id="37">
	A straight path hemmed by green grass\nand sparse stands of trees.
</text>
<text id="38">
	At the end of the path stands the\ngateway to Pal Park.
</text>
<text id="39">
	A sandy beach extends from the road.\nThe beach is busy with avid Fishermen\nhappily casting at the water’s edge.
</text>
<text id="40">
	A man who loves fishing lives near\nhere. There is also a man who will\ncompare sizes of caught fish.
</text>
<text id="41">
	A marine route that requires travelers\nto navigate around jutting rocks and\nsandbars.
</text>
<text id="42">
	With grass fields, rocky outcroppings,\nthe sea, and sandbars, this area is\nlike a miniature of the Sinnoh region.
</text>
<text id="43">
	The path makes its way up and down\namong rocky outcroppings. It is\nphysically challenging.
</text>
<text id="44">
	A path that winds precariously along\nsheer cliffs that go right to the edge\nof the sea’s pounding waves.
</text>
<text id="45">
	There is a small island in the bay.\nAn odd man who speaks foreign\nlanguages lives there.
</text>
<text id="46">
	A rugged and steep mountain path\nwhere vision is limited by steadily\nfalling volcanic ash.
</text>
<text id="47">
	This rough path is harshly raked by\na horizontally blowing sandstorm\ndriven by strong winds off the sea.
</text>
<text id="48">
	A seaside path that makes its way\nthrough wildly growing trees and\nplants.
</text>
<text id="49">
	A sea route that stretches from west\nto east. There is an island that is\nrich with plant life along the way.
</text>
<text id="50">
	A straight path bounded by the sea on\nboth sides. It leads to the Flower\nParadise.
</text>
<text id="51">
	A small town with the fresh scent\nof new leaves in the air. It feels\nlike a place where adventures start.
</text>
<text id="52">
	Your own home and your best friend’s\nhouse are located here.
</text>
<text id="53">
	A sandy town that is located right\nnext to a beach. It is redolent with\nthe salty scent of the sea.
</text>
<text id="54">
	Prof. Rowan’s lab is the town’s\nlandmark. He conducts his\nstudies on Pokémon here.
</text>
<text id="55">
	A town of flower lovers, Floaroma Town\nis always perfumed with the sweet\nscent of flowers.
</text>
<text id="56">
	A short, floral pathway opens up to\na sprawling sea of flowers in bloom.
</text>
<text id="57">
	In the center of town is the flower\nshop called Pick a Peck of Colors.
</text>
<text id="58">
	The temperate climate makes this town\na relaxed and casual place for people\nand Pokémon to live in.
</text>
<text id="59">
	There is a Pokémon Day Care and\na Pokémon Center here.
</text>
<text id="60">
	Beyond a path hemmed by stands of\ntrees, one can find the entrance\nto the Solaceon Ruins.
</text>
<text id="61">
	A tiny town that preserves the history\nof Sinnoh and the old ways of life.
</text>
<text id="62">
	In the center of the town is a small\nshrine that dates to ancient times.
</text>
<text id="63">
	A town where hot-blooded Trainers\ngather to work out and hone their\nbattling skills.
</text>
<text id="64">
	A town that attracts Trainers who\nknow there are other ways of enjoying\nPokémon than battling.
</text>
<text id="65">
	The most modernized city in the Sinnoh\nregion. It is bustling with people on\nthe go.
</text>
<text id="66">
	The Pokétch Company, the developer\nand manufacturer of the Pokétch, is\nlocated here.
</text>
<text id="67">
	Jubilife TV, Sinnoh’s TV network, is\nlocated here. It is an entertaining\nplace to visit.
</text>
<text id="68">
	The Global Terminal is located here.\nIt is your connection to the entire\nworld.
</text>
<text id="69">
	Located here is the Trainers’ School.\nDrop in to study up on the basics of\nPokémon.
</text>
<text id="70">
	A port city that is bisected by a\ncanal. It has a distinctly exotic air\nof foreign culture.
</text>
<text id="71">
	Head to the library if you want a\nworkout for the mind. Head to the Gym\nif you just want to work out.
</text>
<text id="72">
	Large ships can always be seen\nmoored at the town’s piers.
</text>
<text id="73">
	A vibrant and energetic mining town\nthat is blessed with a precious natural\nresource.
</text>
<text id="74">
	There is a Gym where mine workers\ntake breaks in between their\nexhausting work shifts.
</text>
<text id="75">
	There is a museum that specializes in\nexhibits related to the town’s coal\nmine.
</text>
<text id="76">
	Huge deposits of coal still sleep\nunderneath the ground. The entrance\nto the Oreburgh Mine is here.
</text>
<text id="77">
	An old city that shows fading and\nalmost-forgotten vestiges of ancient\nhistory.
</text>
<text id="78">
	The Cycle Shop is located here.\nThere is also a big building with\na slightly sinister atmosphere.
</text>
<text id="79">
	A statue of an ancient Pokémon is\nprominently and reverentially displayed.
</text>
<text id="80">
	A Gym is indispensable in any town that\nhas many people coming and going.\nThis city is no exception.
</text>
<text id="81">
	This friendly city started as a place\nwhere people and Pokémon gathered,\nthen grew into a center of commerce.
</text>
<text id="82">

</text>
<text id="83">

<text id="84">

<text id="85">
	A nice fountain with benches, as well\nas the Pokémon Fan Club, are among\nthe city’s amenities.

<text id="86">

<text id="87">
	The Gym is a good example of the\nabundant water resources available to\nthe city.
</text>
<text id="88">

<text id="89">
	This city was made by carving out\nsteep, rocky mountains. Its isolation\nlimits its contact with other cities.

<text id="0">
	Forget it!\nThis isn’t over yet!\n
</text>
<text id="1">
	My Pokémon’s getting low on HP...\nThings could be tight here.\n
</text>
<text id="2">
	What’s going on here?\nWhat, I lost?!\n
</text>
<text id="3">
	Think you can take down the \nnext Pokémon like you did earlier?\n
</text>
<text id="4">
	No way! Not yet!\nNot giving up!\n
</text>
<text id="5">
	W-what? That can’t be!\nMy buffed-up Pokémon!\n

<text id="2458">
	At times we battle, and sometimes we\nteam up...\rIt’s great how Trainers can interact.\n
</text>
<text id="2459">
	...My time with you is drawing to a\nclose...\n
</text>
<text id="2460">
	...Awww.\n
</text>
<text id="2461">
	Now this!\nThis is a smoking-hot situation!\n
</text>
<text id="2462">
	Heeheehee!\nSo hot, you!\n
</text>
<text id="2463">
	Oh, no!\nYou’re too much for me!\n
</text>
<text id="2464">
	Mira wonders if she can get very far in\nthe Battle Tower.\n
</text>
<text id="2465">
	What’s with you?!\nDo you have a vendetta against me?!\n
</text>
<text id="2466">
	Humph! Quit flaunting your toughness!\nIt’s not cute in the least!\n
</text>
<text id="2467">
	Oh, dear... The trouble with fun is that\nit is over so quickly.\n
</text>
<text id="2468">
	Wow!\nYou’re out of this world!\n
</text>
<text id="2469">
	You are good, you!\nMy Pokémon, they have enjoyed it, too!\n
</text>
<text id="2470">
	My Pokémon can’t be faulted with\nanything.\rYour brilliance carried the day.\n
</text>
<text id="2471">
	It’s not over yet!\nA League Elite Four can’t give up!\n
</text>
<text id="2472">
	I will now concede defeat.\rBut I think you came to see how\ngreat Bug-type Pokémon can be.\rI hope you also realized what you’re\nup against in the Pokémon League.\rBattling is a deep and complex\naffair...\n
</text>
<text id="2473">
	Dear child, don’t assume for an\ninstant that you’ve won.\n
</text>
<text id="2474">
	Well! Dear child, I must say, that\nwas most impressive.\rYour Pokémon believed in you and did\ntheir best to earn you the win.\rEven though I’ve lost, I find myself\nwith this silly grin!\n
</text>
<text id="2475">
	I can feel your determination.\nYour will is overpowering me!\n
</text>
<text id="2476">
	This situation...\nThis is heating up! I’m blazing now!\n
</text>
<text id="2477">
	...!\rI don’t believe it! I lost!\nI didn’t take you for granted...\rBut I never expected you to win!\nI’d never even considered it!\rI’m blown away by this!\nYou and your Pokémon are hot stuff!\n
</text>
<text id="2478">
	Hmm...\nNow what should I do...\n
</text>
<text id="2479">
	I see...\rYour getting past the three before\nme was no fluke. Your power is real.\n
</text>
<text id="2480">
	I can’t remember the last time I\nwas put in a corner like this!\n
</text>
<text id="2481">
	I won’t let this end yet! This match\nis too fun to let it end this easily!\n
</text>
<text id="2482">
	...Just a few minutes ago, you were\nthe most powerful challenger.\rAnd just now, you became the most\npowerful of all the Trainers.\rYou are now our newest Champion!\n
</text>
<text id="2483">
	No way! I won’t give up!\nThere’s never any giving up!
</text>
<text id="2484">
	What was that about?!\rI’m going to get tougher, though!\nTougher with these guys!\n
</text>
<text id="2485">
	No way! I won’t give up!\nThere’s never any giving up!
</text>
<text id="2486">
	What was that about?!\rI’m going to get tougher, though!\nTougher with these guys!\n
</text>
<text id="2487">
	No way! I won’t give up!\nThere’s never any giving up!
</text>
<text id="2488">
	What was that about?!\rI’m going to get tougher, though!\nTougher with these guys!\n
</text>
<text id="2489">
	Ouch! Are you one of those loyal\nfans? You sure are rowdy!\n
</text>
<text id="2490">
	My camera’s too heavy.\nI couldn’t battle effectively...\n
</text>
<text id="2491">
	You beat me, but...\nI feel totally amped to jam harder!\n
</text>
<text id="2492">
	The camera is our witness!\nIt has recorded our defeat...\n
</text>
<text id="2493">
	You have a superstar quality!\nYou sure could become a celebrity!\n
</text>
<text id="2494">
	Oh, no, no, no!\nMwahahah?\n
</text>
<text id="2495">
	Pi-Pikachu!\n
</text>
<text id="2496">
	The press is the victim!\n
</text>
</file>

	Rt. 227\nRt. 228

<file id="643" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Hey, konnichiwa!\nGlad to meet you, guten tag!\rI’m the Meister.\rIn this language’s parlance I would\nbe called a craftsman.\rSomething like that, n’est ce pas?\nComprendo?\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	So, sniff, sniff, I smell you!\nI smell something about you!\rThere is no question! You are a lover\nof Pokémon just like me!\rThis is wunderbar!\nSo, this is what I will do.\rI will power up your Pokédex so you\ncan read the descriptions of Pokémon\lin other languages!\rJe suis desolee, but not for all\nPokémon, however.\rOnly the Pokémon of countries I,\nthe Meister, have visited.\rNow, may I see your Pokédex?\nSo, I change this setting here...\lFool with this here... And done!\rNow, you may read the descriptions\nof the Meister’s Pokémon favorites\lin other languages. How uber!
</text>
<text id="2">
	Hey, konnichiwa!\nBonjour and all the rest!\rHave you a Pokémon named FINNEON?\nC’est un Pokémon fish-style?\rIf you will be so kind, trade it will\nyou for my precious MAGIKARP?
</text>
<text id="3">
	Danke schon, arigato, gracias,\nand what-have-you!\rThat MAGIKARP, it accompanied me from\nthe country of my birth.\rBe good to it, I beseech you!
</text>
<text id="4">
	Oh, non, non! That is no FINNEON!\nWhat I want is a FINNEON!\lYou have made the Meister melancholy!
</text>
<text id="5">
	Oh! This is a tragedy!\nA tragedy, I tell you!\rBut one day, you will trade me\nthe Pokémon I want!\rThe Meister knows this because I have\ntraveled the world!
</text>
<text id="6">
	Because there are Pokémon, I can\nmake friends anywhere in the world.\rIt so inspires me knowing that.\nIt’s so wonderful in a wonderful way!
</text>
<text id="7">
	There is something scribbled on this\nnotice.\r“The world-traveling Meister has\nvisited over 150 countries!\r“But the world remains as big as ever!”
</text>

<text id="1">
	Hold it right there, Trainer!\rIf you’re in the Fight Area, you’ve got\nto visit the Battle Frontier.\rYou don’t earn Exp. Points, and your\nPokédex isn’t updated there.\rIt’s a place solely for Trainers to\nhone their own skills.
</text>
<text id="2">
	Howdy, Trainer!\nYou have a Pokédex, do you?\rHere’s my advice: go out and\nchallenge other Trainers!\rThey’ll often have different Pokémon,\nso your Pokédex should fill up fast!

</text>
<text id="457">
	The user delivers a\nlife-endangering head\nbutt at full power.\nThe user also takes\nterrible damage.
</text>
<text id="458">
	The user slams the\nfoe with a tail, etc.\nThe target is hit\ntwice in a row.\n
</text>
<text id="459">
	The user blasts the\nfoe with power that\ndistorts even time.\nThe user must rest\non the next turn.
</text>
<text id="460">
	The user tears the\nfoe along with the\nspace around it.\nThis move has a high\ncritical-hit ratio.
</text>
<text id="461">
	The user faints. In\nreturn, the Pokémon\ntaking its place will\nhave its status and\nHP fully restored.
</text>
<text id="462">
	The foe is crushed\nwith great force.\nThe attack is more\npowerful the more HP\nthe foe has left.
</text>
<text id="463">
	The foe becomes\ntrapped within a\nmaelstrom of fire\nthat rages for two\nto five turns.
</text>
<text id="464">
	The foe is dragged\ninto a world of total\ndarkness that puts it\nto sleep.\n
</text>
<text id="465">
	The user generates\na shock wave from\nwithin its body.\nIt may also lower the\ntarget’s Sp. Def.
</text>
<text id="466">
	The user creates a\ngust of repulsive\nwind. It may also\nraise all the user’s\nstats at once.
</text>
<text id="467">
	The user disappears,\nthen strikes the foe\non the second turn.\nIt hits even if the\nfoe used Protect.
</text>
</file>

<text id="36">
	\v0600ぁ\x0000\x0000\rPress down on the pump from\ndirectly above to pump maximum\lair into a balloon until it pops.\rPop balloons until time runs out.\rPressing the pump hard will make it\nturn red, increasing its capacity.\rThe circling WYNAUT can also help.\rLine a WYNAUT up with the pump to\nboost the air volume, but beware:\rlining up the pump with a skinny\nWYNAUT reduces the air volume.\r
